request.description:
## Request for Obtaining a Short-Lived Access Token

### Purpose

This request is used to obtain a short-lived access token for authentication.

### Method

POST

### URL

`https://api.instagram.com/oauth/access_token`

### Headers

- `Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded`
    

### Parameters

The request body must include the following parameters:

- **client_id** (string): `Instagram app ID` from Facebook App page.
    
- **client_secret** (string): `Instagram app secret`.
    
- **grant_type** (string): The type of grant, typically "authorization_code".
    
- **redirect_uri** (string): The URI to redirect to after authorization.
    
- **code** (string): The authorization code received from the authorization step.
    

### Response

The expected response will be in JSON format and may include:

- **access_token** (string): The short-lived access token.
    
- **user_id** (integer): The ID of the user.
    
- **permissions** (array): An array of permissions granted to the access token.=
    

#### Example Response

``` json
{
  "access_token": "your_access_token",
  "user_id": 123456789,
  "permissions": ["basic", "public_content"]
}

 ```

### Error Response

In case of an error, the response may look like:

``` json
{
  "error_type": "",
  "code": 0,
  "error_message": ""
}

 ```

### Additional Documentation

For more information, refer to the following links:

- [Step 1: Get Authorization](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/instagram-platform/instagram-api-with-instagram-login/business-login#step-1--get-authorization)
    
- [Step 2: Exchange the Code for a Token](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/instagram-platform/instagram-api-with-instagram-login/business-login#step-2---exchange-the-code-for-a-token)

request.description:
## Get a Long-Lived Access Token

This request exchanges a short-lived Instagram access token for a long-lived access token. This is essential for applications that require extended access to the Instagram Graph API without needing to re-authenticate frequently.

### Request

**Method:** GET  
**URL:** `https://graph.instagram.com/access_token`

#### Query Parameters

- `grant_type` (string): Must be set to `ig_exchange_token` to indicate the type of token exchange.
    
- `client_secret` (string): Your application's client secret, which is `Instagram app secret`
    
- `access_token` (string): The short-lived access token that you got from route `https://api.instagram.com/oauth/access_token`.
    

### Response

The response will be in JSON format. Below are the expected fields in both successful and error responses:

#### Successful Response

- **HTTP Status Code:** 200
    

``` json
{
    "access_token": "", 
    "token_type": "", 
    "expires_in": 0 
}

 ```

- `access_token` (string): The newly issued long-lived access token.
    
- `token_type` (string): The type of token returned, typically "bearer".
    
- `expires_in` (integer): The lifetime in seconds of the access token.
    

#### Error Response

- **HTTP Status Code:** 400
    

``` json
{
    "error": {
        "message": "",
        "type": "",
        "code": 0,
        "error_subcode": 0,
        "is_transient": true,
        "error_user_title": "",
        "error_user_msg": "",
        "fbtrace_id": ""
    }
}

 ```

- `error`: An object containing details about the error.
    
    - `message` (string): A description of the error (may be empty).
        
    - `type` (string): The type of error that occurred (may be empty).
        
    - `code` (integer): A numeric code representing the error.
        
    - `error_subcode` (integer): A subcode providing more detail about the error.
        
    - `is_transient` (boolean): Indicates whether the error is transient (true) or not (false).
        
    - `error_user_title` (string): A user-friendly title for the error (may be empty).
        
    - `error_user_msg` (string): A user-friendly message describing the error (may be empty).
        
    - `fbtrace_id` (string): An identifier for tracing the error in Facebook's systems.
        

### Notes

- Ensure that the `client_secret` and `access_token` parameters are correctly provided to avoid errors.
    
- The access token returned can be used for making further API requests without the need for frequent re-authentication.
    

For more information, refer to the [Instagram Graph API documentation](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/instagram-platform/instagram-api-with-instagram-login/business-login#long-lived).

request.description:
## Refresh Long-Lived Instagram Access Token

This endpoint allows you to refresh a long-lived Instagram access token. It is essential for maintaining access to Instagram's Graph API without requiring the user to re-authenticate.

### Endpoint

`/refresh_access_token`

### Method

`GET`

### Parameters

- **grant_type**:
    
    - Type: `text`
        
    - Description: Set this parameter to `ig_refresh_token` to indicate that you are refreshing an existing long-lived access token.
        
- **access_token**:
    
    - Type: `text`
        
    - Description: This is the long-lived access token that is about to expire. It must be valid and at least 24 hours old.
        

### Conditions

- The existing long-lived access token must be at least 24 hours old.
    
- The existing long-lived access token must be valid (not expired).
    
- The app user must have granted your app the `instagram_business_basic` permission.
    

### Expiration

Tokens that have not been refreshed in 60 days will expire and can no longer be refreshed.

### Response

On a successful request, the response will contain:

- `access_token`: The new long-lived access token.
    
- `token_type`: The type of token returned.
    
- `expires_in`: The duration in seconds until the token expires.
    
- `permissions`: The permissions granted to the token.
    

#### Example Response

``` json
{
  "access_token": "",
  "token_type": "",
  "expires_in": 0,
  "permissions": ""
}

 ```

[https://developers.facebook.com/docs/instagram-platform/reference/refresh_access_token](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/instagram-platform/reference/refresh_access_token)

item.name: Instagram User

request.description:
### Endpoint

`GET /me`

### Description

Retrieves the profile information for an Instagram business or creator account.

### Parameters

- **fields**: A comma-separated list of fields to retrieve. Possible values include:
    
    - `biography`: The biography of the user.
        
    - `user_id`: Instagram user id
        
    - `followers_count`: The number of followers of the user's Instagram professional account.
        
    - `follows_count`: The number of Instagram accounts the user follows.
        
    - `id`: The app user's app-scoped ID.
        
    - `media_count`: The number of media objects on the user's account.
        
    - `name`: The name of the user.
        
    - `profile_picture_url`: The URL for the user's profile picture.
        
    - `username`: The user's Instagram username.
        
    - `website`: The user's website URL.
        
- **access_token**: The access token from the app dashboard.
    

### Example Request

```
GET /me?fields=biography,followers_count,follows_count,id,media_count,name,profile_picture_url,username,website&access_token=YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN

 ```

### Documentation

For more information, refer to the official documentation: [Instagram API Documentation](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/instagram-platform/instagram-api-with-instagram-login/get-started#get-the-app-user-id---username)

request.description:
### Instagram Media Retrieval API

This API endpoint retrieves a list of media objects published by the Instagram business or creator account. It requires the `instagram_basic` permission for access.

#### Request

- **Method**: GET
    
- **URL**: `{{base_url}}/{{api_version}}/{{instagram_account_id}}/media`
    
- **Query Parameters**:
    
    - `fields`: (string) A comma-separated list of fields to return for each media object. Possible values include:
        
        - `id`: The unique identifier for the media object.
            
        - `caption`: The caption of the media.
            
        - `media_type`: The type of media (e.g., IMAGE, VIDEO).
            
        - `media_url`: The URL of the media.
            
        - `permalink`: The permanent link to the media object.
            
        - `thumbnail_url`: The URL of the thumbnail image (if applicable).
            
        - `timestamp`: The time the media was created.
            
        - `username`: The username of the account that posted the media.
            
        - `like_count`: The number of likes the media has received.
            
        - `comments_count`: The number of comments on the media.
            
    - `access_token`: (string) A valid access token with the necessary permissions.
        

#### Authentication

To authenticate requests, you must include a valid `access_token` in the query parameters. This token should be obtained through the Instagram API authentication process.

#### Response Fields

- `data`: An array of media objects, each containing:
    
    - `id`: Unique identifier for the media object.
        
    - `caption`: Caption of the media.
        
    - `media_type`: Type of media (e.g., IMAGE, VIDEO).
        
    - `media_url`: URL of the media.
        
    - `permalink`: Permanent link to the media.
        
    - `thumbnail_url`: URL of the thumbnail image (if applicable).
        
    - `timestamp`: Creation time of the media.
        
    - `username`: Username of the account that posted the media.
        
    - `like_count`: Number of likes.
        
    - `comments_count`: Number of comments.
        
- `paging`: Contains pagination information:
    
    - `cursors`: Indicates the position for the next page of results.
        
    - `next`: URL to fetch the next page of results, if available.
        

#### Example Response

``` json
{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "123456",
      "caption": "A beautiful sunset!",
      "media_type": "IMAGE",
      "media_url": "https://example.com/media/123456.jpg",
      "permalink": "https://instagram.com/p/123456",
      "thumbnail_url": "https://example.com/media/thumbnail/123456.jpg",
      "timestamp": "2023-10-01T12:00:00+0000",
      "username": "example_user",
      "like_count": 100,
      "comments_count": 10
    }
  ],
 ```
